content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

In Julia, to define a `FloatWithUnits` struct with fields `value` and `unit`, you can use the following code:
```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end
```
Now, to write a `show` method for the `FloatWithUnits` struct that concatenates the value and unit with a space, you can use the following code:
```julia
function show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, fwu.value, " ", fwu.unit)
end
```
This `show` method will display the value and unit of a `FloatWithUnits` struct on the screen or in any output stream like this: "1.8 meters".
